com.yantra.api.ysc.attribute

Interface manageAttribute

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface manageAttribute

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageAttribute(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageAttribute API manages an attribute with operations to create, modify, and delete an attribute and its allowed value list.

    • Method Detail

      • manageAttribute

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageAttribute(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageAttribute API manages an attribute with operations to create, modify, and delete an attribute and its allowed value list.

        If the DataType of this attribute is a BOOLEAN, then the Value attribute of its AttributeAllowedValue has to be a Y/N/y/n. If the DataType of this attribute is an INTEGER, then the NumericStep attribute of its AttributeAllowedValue must also be an Integer. For a DataType of INTEGER or DECIMAL, negative values are not supported for Value attribute of AttributeAllowedValue record. So, also the size of a numeric value is not validated against size of the database column of entity YFS_ADDITIONAL_ATTRIBUTE where the actual assigned value is stored. For a DataType of INTEGER or DECIMAL, if the Attribute is configured with AllowMultipleValues set to 'N', and AttributeAllowedValue has IsDefaultValue set to 'Y', then a range of values are not allowed.

        An attribute may be defined to represent certain aspect of another attribute. For instance, an attribute called Price may be defined to define price of an item. To know what range this price falls under, another attribute called PriceRange may be defined. Such an attribute is a derived attribute. A derived attribute is not supported for Attribute DataType of 'TEXT' or 'BOOLEAN'. A derived attribute may be assigned to a category, but its value may not be assigned to a category or item. It is only used to display the range aspect of Price attribute.

        The Attributes may be re-arranged in an order within its AttributeGroup using SequenceNo. For better performance, SequenceNos, if passed in the input, must not be contiguous. They must be preferably in steps of 100. If an InsertBefore element is passed in the input, the SequenceNo is computed for that Attribute to be less than the SequenceNo of the InsertBefore element. An update of SequenceNo for all records appearing after this record in sequence is performed, if necessary. To avoid computed SequenceNos from running out of permitted maximum value of 99999, they must begin at the lower end of the possible values such as 10 or 100.

        Existing item fields, extended fields, and item alias names, may be configured as attributes to represent the existing columns. This information will be stored in the YFS_ATTRIBUTE_REFERENCE table. The DataType of this attribute will be defaulted from the DataType of the column AttributeReference points to. An Attribute with an AttributeReference record may not have AttributeAllowedValues defined.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: These events are raised under the ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION transaction.

        ON_CHANGE:

          This event is raised on successful creation, modification or deletion of Attribute.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: On Change Event XML
          Template Support: Yes

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the details of the attribute group. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
